critique: The executive order seems to want to convey a sense of urgency and decisiveness in addressing the banking emergency. It aims to instill confidence that the government is taking action. The primary emotions conveyed are likely to be a sense of relief (joy) that the government is addressing the issue, and perhaps a touch of surprise at the speed and directness of the action. There might also be a slight undercurrent of fear, acknowledging the severity of the situation, but this is less prominent. Disgust and sadness are not primary emotions here.
